actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-578, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 5132. Upon the adoption of this resolution, it shall be in order, any rule of the House to the contrary notwithstanding, to consider in the House a indivisible motion: 1) to adopt the conference report on H.R. 5132; 2) to agreed to the motions printed in the joint explanatory statement of the committee of conference to dispose of disagreements reported from conference on Senate amendments numbered 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 12, and 13; and 3) to agree to the motions printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution to dispose of disagreements reported from
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 151.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the conference report and amendments reported from conference in disagreement on the bill (H.R. 5132) making dire emergency supplemental appropriations for disaster assistance to meet urgent needs because of calamities such as those which occurred in Los Angeles, and Chicago, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Provides for the consideration of the conference report and amendments reported from conference in disagreement on H.R. 5132 (dire emergency supplemental appropriations).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the conference report and amendments reported from conference in disagreement on the bill (H.R. 5132) making dire emergency supplemental appropriations for disaster assistance to meet urgent needs because of calamities such as those which occurred in Los Angeles, and Chicago, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.
